doc.previous: In 1865 Louis Pierre Mouillard published an influential book The Empire Of The Air (l'Empire de l'Air).
doc.after: In 1856, Frenchman Jean-Marie Le Bris made the first flight higher than his point of departure, by having his glider "L'Albatros artificiel" pulled by a horse on a beach. He reportedly achieved a height of 100 meters, over a distance of 200 meters.
